intro: Grosourdya bicornuta, commonly known as the two-horned grosourdia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive two-horned calyx at the base of its flowers. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Grosourdya bicornuta is often found in moist, shaded forest environments. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a velvety texture.
